definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: This outsider was fleeced when he was shopping in a local shop.
sentences.chinese: 这个外地人在当地的一家商店购物时挨宰了。

sentences.english: But ask a non-Beijinger, and you may get a different answer.
sentences.chinese: 但是，问问那些外地人，可能会有不同的答案。
你可能说的没错，外地人先生。

sentences.english: There are many foreigners in Shanghai, so the fluxion of population is very large.
sentences.chinese: 在上海有很多外地人，所以上海人口流动很大。

sentences.english: Being an out-of-towner in a small town put him at a disadvantage too.
sentences.chinese: 另外我们作为这个小镇的外地人的情况对他也很不利。

sentences.english: Their accent couldn't fool a native speaker.
sentences.chinese: 当地人一听口音，就知道他们是外地人。

sentences.english: Many non-natives come to tour our island.
Out-of-towners may easily lose their way in New York City's labyrinthine subway passages.
sentences.chinese: 外地人很容易在纽约地铁如迷宫般的人行地道里迷路。
你可能说的没错，外地人女士。

sentences.english: So the problem of public security leads to the conflicts between the locals and the strangers.
sentences.chinese: 治安问题导致本地人与外地人的矛盾加剧。

sentences.english: A generation ago, few outsiders had ever heard of Lake Lugu or the Mosuo.
sentences.chinese: 在上一代，少有外地人听说过泸沽湖或摩梭族。

definition: parts of the country other than where one is
Beijing resident/Peking ape-man, Homo erectus pekinensis (c. 600,000 BC), discovered in 1921 at Zhoukoudian 周口店[Zhou1 kou3 dian4], Beijing
another part of the country/some other place
Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou/abbr. for 北京、上海、廣州|北京、上海、广州
native place/place of origin/home state or region
